glsa.title: gThumb: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in gThumb might allow remote attacker(s) to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: gThumb is an image viewer and browser for GNOME.

description.p: A heap-based buffer overflow in gThumbâ€™s _cairo_image_surface_create_from_jpeg() function, located in extensions/cairo_io/cairo-image-surface-jpeg.c was discovered.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file using gThumb, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All gThumb users should upgrade to the latest version:
